meanings.definition: Yangs: third person singular present of yang
meanings.sent1: She yangs every morning before school.
meanings.sent2: He always yangs when he is happy.
meanings.sent3: The cat yangs loudly when it wants attention.
meanings.sent4: The birds outside yang joyfully in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The river yangs peacefully as it flows by.

meanings.sent1: There are many different yangs in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The yin and yangs represent balance in Chinese philosophy.
meanings.sent3: The box was full of colorful yangs for the children to play with.
meanings.sent4: The artist used various yangs to create a beautiful mosaic.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with blooming yangs of all shapes and sizes.

meanings.definition: Yangs: a Chinese unit of weight equal to 37.5 grams
meanings.sent1: She measured the flour using two yangs.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry was so delicate, each piece weighed only a few yangs.
meanings.sent3: The chef added three yangs of sugar to the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The tiny bird weighed less than a yang.
meanings.sent5: The medicine was carefully measured in precise yangs for accuracy.
